com.conversant.assignment.java.concurrent

Class ThreadManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.conversant.assignment.java.concurrent.ThreadManager

  • public class ThreadManager
extends java.lang.Object
    Helper class with methods which, 1. creates pool of # threads using ExecutorService, 2. does explicit and safe shutdown of ExecutorService, 3. waits on result of each asynchronous task, 4. sorts and prints records for each child on console of main.

        public ThreadManager()

    • Method Detail

      • generateChildThreads

        public static java.util.concurrent.Future<Message>[] generateChildThreads(int threadCount,
                                                          java.lang.String workingDir)
        generateChildThreads - creates pool of 10 threads using ExecutorService.
        Parameters:
        threadCount - - number of threads to be generated and executed in parallel.
        Returns:
        Future[] - A Future represents the result of an asynchronous computation. Message is the data shared between child thread and main thread. Future[] is the array of result of threads executed in parallel.

      • shutDown

        public static boolean shutDown()
        Explicit and safe shutdown.
        Returns:
        boolean (true/false) - success/failure of completion of execution of each thread in ExecutionService.

      • getResultFromEachChild

        public static java.util.List<Message> getResultFromEachChild(java.util.concurrent.Future<Message>[] results)
        A Future represents the result of an asynchronous computation. get() method waits if necessary for the computation to complete, and then retrieves its result.
        Parameters:
        results - - array of results of asynchronous threads/tasks.
        Returns:
        List - returns list of messages from all threads/tasks, where message is data object shared between child thread and main thread. This method handles - CancellationException, ExecutionException and InterruptedException thrown by get() on Future.

      • sortAndPrintMessages

        public static void sortAndPrintMessages(java.util.List<Message> messages)
        sorts the Collection of Message according to PID and displays messages on the console
        Parameters:
        messages - - Collection of Message from all threads/tasks where Message is the data object shared between child thread and main thread
